0.text: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.
0.author: Albert Einstein

1.text: A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.
1.author: Jane Austen

2.text: Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory.
2.author: J.K. Rowling

3.text: I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library.
3.author: Jane Austen

4.text: There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense.
4.author: Jane Austen

5.text: Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again.
5.author: C.S. Lewis

6.text: We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be.
6.author: C.S. Lewis

7.text: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
7.author: Mark Twain

8.text: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.
8.author: Mark Twain

9.text: I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.
9.author: C.S. Lewis
